blog.name: amateur-crastinator
blog.title: Amateur Thoughts
blog.description: You want it, I probably don’t got it. Almost no pattern to brand this train wreck of a blog as. It’s updated as I have weird thoughts or brainstorms. Yeah, that’s pretty much it.

tags: we were deprived of peeves gosh darnit i have permission to be peeved
body:
Justice for Peeves

I understand why certain elements from the books were excluded in the Harry Potter films, but we were done dirty when they left out all mention of Peeves.

Although…I guess you could say that I’m rather…peeved. Oh gosh, I want to create an account now just to follow this blog, read this post, and unfollow it.

body:
unpopular opinion

I feel like people keep praising Slytherin,, like they always doubt the other houses and somehow Slytherin has all the characteristics in some headcanons, like some peeps dont stick with the actual house traits and instead morph Slytherins into this almighty and higher house that completes every challenge,, like no pls stop I love slytherin but u gotta make them accurate

blog.name: sarcasm-muses

blog.description:
Independent Roleplay/Ask blog. 
Multimuses (Tobirama, Itama, Iruka, Madara, Izuna, Gellert & Rian - OC). Multifandoms (Naruto, Harry Potter & a Cross over with Pokemon). Multi-ships. Multi-Verses. 
Make sure to check Rules and Map before you interact with him. 
Mun is called Ivy, I don't bite so hit me up with a roleplay or ask if you wanted.
est May 9, 2918

summary: You know? I think Gellert is someone who capable to love, someone who can love and give love, it is his greatest weapon because...
body:
You know? I think Gellert is someone who capable to love, someone who can love and give love, it is his greatest weapon because he can make people submit to him, to devote their everything to him willingly. But at the same time, it is also that love which is his down fall.

He cares too much, loves too deep and his goal, the goal everyone trust, in the end, it just because of someone, the beginning of everything, the start of his dream and his goal, sum up by just a name - Albus.

He is out there, growing stronger than ever, feared and lovwd by everyone, but there is only one person that worth his attention.

As I said, he loves too much and he is unable to let go of the past, the memories, the feelings and in the end, it is what bring him down. Not Albus but his own feelings, in my view, he is such a pitiful proud man who need no one’s pity.

Though that make me wonder, just how deep Albus feels for Gellert? For a brave Gryffindor, in the end, he still doesn’t have enough courage to see Gellert one more time, don’t you think so?

body:
I need a James and a Sirius

Okay so I just finished working up a script, so here’s a little sample of what’s going on but it’s projected to be about 28 gifs of how the Potters got a cat.

If you’re interested for either role, please drop a comment or PM me.

Here’s a sample of my Lily, just so you get an idea:

Anyway, thank you so much! Please let me know if you’re interested in a collaboration!

summary: And the finale of the Happy Potter themed drinks this evening is... Glorious Gryffindor!  1. 1 shot of vodka 2. 1 standard drink...
caption:
And the finale of the Happy Potter themed drinks this evening is… Glorious Gryffindor!


1. 1 shot of vodka

2. 1 standard drink of white wine (cheap brands are fine)

3. Fill the rest of the glass with red soft drink or cordial

4. Add pearl shimmer dust, usually found in the baking section of supermarkets. I used gold for this one.

5. Swirl around, and enjoy!

blog.name: bluewithpurplepolkadots

blog.description: Either bi or a lesbian, and still unsure even though I have recently become officially old. Originally from N.Ireland, currently working in England. Favourite movie is Monsters Inc. Attempts to write are often sporadic. Will tag if need be just ask.

summary: I remember once reading somewhere that someone had the idea that pottermore articles are made better by pretending that it was...
body:
I remember once reading somewhere that someone had the idea that pottermore articles are made better by pretending that it was written by actual characters in the books. As in people who would be heavily biased in some way: and thus they are not perfect representations of what actually went down.

I really like that idea.

Personally, on this basis, I think for instance the founders pages would have been written by Hermione. Or at least the Gryffindor pages. They’re technically accurate in relation to the /heavily biased/ history books (written by wizards) she may have read and she throws a token effort of being understanding of Goblins (even though the article makes out the whole mess with the sword as Goblins lying outright… ugh) but overall it’s not really something which necessarily jives with what REALLY went down. Because biased textbooks. And the fact it was 1000 years ago and the ghosts like the baron or grey lady are just as biased themselves as regular wizards. And perhaps have the ability or want to whitewash history themselves.

It’s possible that the goblins always had that idea about ownership. And that Godric knew but just didn’t care. It’s possible he bumbled in not realising. Or he was in fact respectful but after he died people went against his wishes to return it and then placed words or painted actions he never even did. It’s possible that the article is accurate (as boring as that would be) and the goblins were in the wrong.

But we can’t really know for sure.

I remember once reading somewhere that someone had the idea that pottermore articles are made better by pretending that it was written by actual characters in the books. As in people who would be heavily biased in some way: and thus they are not perfect representations of what actually went down.

I really like that idea.

Personally, on this basis, I think for instance the founders pages would have been written by Hermione. Or at least the Gryffindor pages. They’re technically accurate in relation to the /heavily biased/ history books (written by wizards) she may have read and she throws a token effort of being understanding of Goblins (even though the article makes out the whole mess with the sword as Goblins lying outright… ugh) but overall it’s not really something which necessarily jives with what REALLY went down. Because biased textbooks. And the fact it was 1000 years ago and the ghosts like the baron or grey lady are just as biased themselves as regular wizards. And perhaps have the ability or want to whitewash history themselves.

It’s possible that the goblins always had that idea about ownership. And that Godric knew but just didn’t care. It’s possible he bumbled in not realising. Or he was in fact respectful but after he died people went against his wishes to return it and then placed words or painted actions he never even did. It’s possible that the article is accurate (as boring as that would be) and the goblins were in the wrong.

But we can’t really know for sure.
